intro: Tournefortia brenesii, commonly known as the Bahamian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly the Bahamas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Tournefortia brenesii typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils.
